conclusion: Determine the number of moles of the gas using ideal gas law.
At state A, the pressure is 3 x 10^5 Pa and the volume is 1 x 10^-3 m³.
The temperature at state A is -73°C = 200 K.
Calculate moles: n = (3 x 10^5 Pa)(1 x 10^-3 m³) / (8.314 J/mol·K)(200 K) ≈ 0.18 mol.
Calculate the work done during the process from A to B.
From A to B, the process is isobaric (constant pressure).
Work done W_AB = (3 x 10^5 Pa)(4 x 10^-3 m³ - 1 x 10^-3 m³) = 900 J.
Calculate the work done during the process from B to C.
From B to C, the process is isochoric (constant volume).
Work done W_BC = 0 because there is no change in volume.
Calculate the total work done from A to C.
Total work done W_AC = W_AB + W_BC = 900 J + 0 = 900 J.
Use the first law of thermodynamics to find the heat exchanged.
Using ΔU = Q - W, with ΔU = 200 J and W = 900 J, find Q = 1100 J.
